body_html:
? FYI, based on my code, I did NOT randomizes the initial value of the weights. I make them all constant with tf.constant().

Because of the non-deterministic nature of GPU ops, now I know it is the tf.nn.conv2d() cause optimizer.compute_gradients() to compute random gradients.

By the way, is it possible that, in the tensorflow doc, to list out which tensorflow API/ops are

  1. non-deterministic/deterministic
  2. going to have an option for choosing non-deterministic/deterministic cuDNN algo
    (it seems you guys are working on that :) really appreciate your hard work :)
    #12871
    #10636 )

? FYI, based on my code, I did NOT randomizes the initial value of the weights. I make them all constant with tf.constant().
Because of the non-deterministic nature of GPU ops, now I know it is the tf.nn.conv2d() cause optimizer.compute_gradients() to compute random gradients.
By the way, is it possible that, in the tensorflow doc, to list out which tensorflow API/ops are

body:
? FYI, based on my code, I did NOT randomizes the initial value of the weights. I make them all constant with tf.constant().

Because of the non-deterministic nature of GPU ops, now I know it is the tf.nn.conv2d() cause optimizer.compute_gradients() to compute random gradients. 

By the way, is it possible that, in the tensorflow doc, to list out which tensorflow API/ops are
1. non-deterministic/deterministic
2. going to have an option for choosing non-deterministic/deterministic cuDNN algo
(it seems you guys are working on that :)   really appreciate your hard work :)
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12871
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10636 )
